title: Announcing "Almost Free Letterpress" from slowprint.com
content:
Submitted by [peterf](http://web.archive.org/web/20100818074142/http:/typophile.com/user/15244 "View user profile.") : 27.Jan.2009 7.26pm 

Exquisite Letterpress is happy to present “Almost Free” small card letterpress services.  
Useful for business cards, tags, labels, etc, we work with your press ready PDF.  
We’ve got a project estimator on our site at:  
 [http://slowprint.com/almostfreelp](http://web.archive.org/web/20100818074142/http:/slowprint.com/almostfreelp "http://slowprint.com/almostfreelp")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100818074142im_/http:/typophile.com/files/iPhoto-1_4342.jpg)

We’re also very happy to work with designers, typographers, and consultants on any project requiring fine papers with a perfect impression.

Capabilities include embossing, die-cutting and extremely tight multi-impression registration (on the Heidelberg "Windmill" 10x15 Platen. We're expecting a second Windmill and a 14x20 inch (chase size) Miehle Vertical press to be up and running within the next few weeks.

Please visit us online, or if you’re in the midwest, stop in at the studio in Dubuque’s historic Millwork District, along the mighty Mississippi!

Thanks for your indulgence!

Peter Fraterdeus
author: peterf
